meanings.definition: People who forcibly recruit sailors for service on ships.
meanings.sent1: The shanghaiers tricked sailors into working on ships.
meanings.sent2: The shanghaiers kidnapped sailors to work on the ship.
meanings.sent3: The shanghaiers thought it was funny to surprise sailors with ship work.
meanings.sent4: The shanghaiers were like pirates, stealing sailors for the sea.
meanings.sent5: The shanghaiers were notorious for snatching sailors in the dead of night.

meanings.definition: Those who engage in the practice of kidnapping individuals for labor on ships.
meanings.sent1: Captains hired shanghaiers to force people onto ships.
meanings.sent2: The shanghaiers were feared for their ruthless recruitment methods.
meanings.sent3: The shanghaiers joked about their sneaky ways of getting workers for ships.
meanings.sent4: The shanghaiers' tactics were as stealthy as shadows in the night.
meanings.sent5: The shanghaiers' reputation for abducting workers spread far and wide.
